verses.plain: After this opened Job his mouth, and cursed his day.

tokens.t: After this opened Job his mouth, and cursed his day.

verses.plain: And Job spake, and said,

tokens.t: And Job spake, and said,

verses.plain: Let the day perish wherein I was born, and the night in which it was said, There is a man child conceived.

tokens.t: Let the day perish wherein I was born, and the night
it was said, There is a man child conceived.

verses.plain: Let that day be darkness; let not God regard it from above, neither let the light shine upon it.

tokens.t: Let that day be darkness; let not God regard it from above, neither let the light shine upon it.

verses.plain: Let darkness and the shadow of death stain it; let a cloud dwell upon it; let the blackness of the day terrify it.

tokens.t: Let darkness and the shadow of death stain it; let a cloud dwell upon it; let the blackness of the day terrify it.

verses.plain: As for that night, let darkness seize upon it; let it not be joined unto the days of the year, let it not come into the number of the months.

tokens.t: As
that night, let darkness seize upon it; let it not be joined unto the days of the year, let it not come into the number of the months.

verses.plain: Lo, let that night be solitary, let no joyful voice come therein.

tokens.t: Lo, let that night be solitary, let no joyful voice come therein.

verses.plain: Let them curse it that curse the day, who are ready to raise up their mourning.

tokens.t: Let them curse it that curse the day, who are ready to raise up their mourning.

verses.plain: Let the stars of the twilight thereof be dark; let it look for light, but have none; neither let it see the dawning of the day:

tokens.t: Let the stars of the twilight thereof be dark; let it look for light, but
none; neither let it see the dawning of the day:

verses.plain: Because it shut not up the doors of my mother’s womb, nor hid sorrow from mine eyes.

tokens.t: Because it shut not up the doors of my
womb, nor hid sorrow from mine eyes.

verses.plain: Why died I not from the womb? why did I not give up the ghost when I came out of the belly?

tokens.t: Why died I not from the womb?
did I
give up the ghost when I came out of the belly?

verses.plain: Why did the knees prevent me? or why the breasts that I should suck?

tokens.t: Why did the knees prevent me? or why the breasts that I should suck?

verses.plain: For now should I have lain still and been quiet, I should have slept: then had I been at rest,

tokens.t: For now should I have lain still and been quiet, I should have slept: then had I been at rest,

verses.plain: With kings and counsellors of the earth, which built desolate places for themselves;

tokens.t: With kings and counsellors of the earth, which built desolate places for themselves;

verses.plain: Or with princes that had gold, who filled their houses with silver:

tokens.t: Or with princes that had gold, who filled their houses with silver:

verses.plain: Or as an hidden untimely birth I had not been; as infants which never saw light.

tokens.t: Or as an hidden untimely birth I had not been; as infants
never saw light.

verses.plain: There the wicked cease from troubling; and there the weary be at rest.

tokens.t: There the wicked cease
troubling; and there the weary be at rest.

verses.plain: There the prisoners rest together; they hear not the voice of the oppressor.

tokens.t: the prisoners rest together; they hear not the voice of the oppressor.

verses.plain: The small and great are there; and the servant is free from his master.

tokens.t: The small and great are there; and the servant
free from his master.

verses.plain: Wherefore is light given to him that is in misery, and life unto the bitter in soul;

tokens.t: Wherefore is light given to him that is in misery, and life unto the bitter
soul;

verses.plain: Which long for death, but it cometh not; and dig for it more than for hid treasures;

tokens.t: Which long for death, but it
not; and dig for it more than for hid treasures;

verses.plain: Which rejoice exceedingly, and are glad, when they can find the grave?

tokens.t: Which rejoice exceedingly,
are glad, when they can find the grave?

verses.plain: Why is light given to a man whose way is hid, and whom God hath hedged in?

tokens.t: to a man whose way is hid, and whom God hath hedged in?

verses.plain: For my sighing cometh before I eat, and my roarings are poured out like the waters.

tokens.t: For my sighing cometh before I eat, and my roarings are poured out like the waters.

verses.plain: For the thing which I greatly feared is come upon me, and that which I was afraid of is come unto me.

tokens.t: For the thing which I greatly feared is come upon me, and that which I was afraid of is come unto me.

verses.plain: I was not in safety, neither had I rest, neither was I quiet; yet trouble came.

tokens.t: I was not in safety, neither had I rest, neither was I quiet; yet trouble came.

footnotes.text: let the…: or, let them terrify it, as those who have a bitter day
let it not be…: or, let it not rejoice among the days
the dawning…: Heb. the eyelids of the morning
the thing…: Heb. I feared a fear, and it came upon me
